top_categories.workout_context: Racing Sea Otter Fuego XL isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Sea Otter Fuego XL’s mixed terrain demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Sea Otter Fuego XL’s mixed terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Sea Otter Fuego XL rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Sea Otter Fuego XL when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Sea Otter Fuego XL — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Sea Otter Fuego XL — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed terrain.
Sea Otter Fuego XL’s 7,800ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Sea Otter Fuego XL. Make this intensity feel like home.
Sea Otter Fuego XL’s mixed terrain drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Sea Otter Fuego XL’s 7,800ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Sea Otter Fuego XL’s mixed terrain delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Sea Otter Fuego XL’s 70 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Sea Otter Fuego XL requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed terrain to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and VO2max to prepare you for 70 miles of mixed terrain in Monterey, California.
